title: Alaska Is Buying Up Apple, GE, Microsoft, and Boeing Stock
text:
Alaska’s motto is “North to the future,” but the state’s revenue department also sees the future in some large-cap stocks it bought up in the third quarter.

The Alaska Department of Revenue, which collects and invests public funds, increased investments in Apple (ticker: AAPL), General Electric (GE), Microsoft (MSFT), and Boeing (BA). The latest moves mark a bit of a reversal. The state had sold Apple and Microsoft stock in the first quarter and essentially stood pat on the names in the second quarter. With the stock market’s...
description: The state’s Department of Revenue increased positions in the large-cap stocks in the third quarter. It had been selling Apple and Microsoft stock earlier this year.
